briefdescription.para: Structure initializer for mbox_channel from devicetree.

detaileddescription.para: This helper macro expands to a static initializer for a mbox_channel by reading the relevant device controller and channel number from the devicetree.

briefdescription.para: Get the node identifier for the MBOX controller from a mboxes property by name.
Get a MBOX channel value by name.

memberdef.argsstring: )(const struct device *dev, uint32_t channel, void *user_data, struct mbox_msg *data)
memberdef.name: mbox_callback_t

briefdescription.para: Callback API for incoming MBOX messages.

detaileddescription.para: These callbacks execute in interrupt context. Therefore, use only interrupt-safe APIS. Registration of callbacks is done via mbox_register_callback()
The data parameter must be NULL in signalling mode.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to some private data provided at registration time

memberdef.argsstring: )(const struct device *dev, uint32_t channel, const struct mbox_msg *msg)
memberdef.name: mbox_send_t

briefdescription.para: Callback API to send MBOX messages.

detaileddescription.para: See mbox_send() for function description

briefdescription.para: Callback API to get maximum data size.

detaileddescription.para: See mbox_mtu_get() for argument definitions.

memberdef.argsstring: )(const struct device *dev, uint32_t channel, mbox_callback_t cb, void *user_data)
memberdef.name: mbox_register_callback_t

detaileddescription.para: See mbox_register_callback() for function description

parameterdescription.para: Callback function to execute on incoming message interrupts.
Application-specific data pointer which will be passed to the callback function when executed.

memberdef.argsstring: )(const struct device *dev, uint32_t channel, bool enable)
memberdef.name: mbox_set_enabled_t

briefdescription.para: Callback API upon enablement of interrupts.

detaileddescription.para: See mbox_set_enabled() for function description

parameterdescription.para: Set to 0 to disable and to nonzero to enable.

briefdescription.para: Callback API to get maximum number of channels.

detaileddescription.para: See mbox_max_channels_get() for argument definitions.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct mbox_channel *channel, const struct device *dev, uint32_t ch_id)
memberdef.name: mbox_init_channel

detaileddescription.para: Initialize an mbox_channel passed by the user with a provided MBOX device and channel ID. This function is needed when the information about the device and the channel ID is not in the DT. In the DT case MBOX_DT_CHANNEL_GET() must be used instead.

briefdescription.para: Try to send a message over the MBOX device.

detaileddescription.para: Send a message over an mbox_channel. The msg parameter must be NULL when the driver is used for signalling.
If the msg parameter is not NULL, this data is expected to be delivered on the receiving side using the data parameter of the receiving callback.

parameterdescription.para: If the remote hasn't yet read the last data sent.
If the supplied data size is unsupported by the driver.
If there was a bad parameter, such as: too-large channel descriptor or the device isn't an outbound MBOX channel.
On success, negative value on error.

briefdescription.para: Register a callback function on a channel for incoming messages.

detaileddescription.para: This function doesn't assume anything concerning the status of the interrupts. Use mbox_set_enabled() to enable or to disable the interrupts if needed.

parameterdescription.para: Callback function to execute on incoming message interrupts.
Application-specific data pointer which will be passed to the callback function when executed.
On success, negative value on error.

briefdescription.para: Return the maximum number of bytes possible in an outbound message.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the actual number of bytes that it is possible to send through an outgoing channel.

This number can be 0 when the driver only supports signalling or when on the receiving side the content and size of the message must be retrieved in an indirect way (i.e. probing some other peripheral, reading memory regions, etc...).
If this function returns 0, the msg parameter in mbox_send() is expected to be NULL.

simplesect.para: Maximum possible size of a message in bytes, 0 for signalling, negative value on error.

briefdescription.para: Enable (disable) interrupts and callbacks for inbound channels.

detaileddescription.para: Enable interrupt for the channel when the parameter 'enable' is set to true. Disable it otherwise.

Immediately after calling this function with 'enable' set to true, the channel is considered enabled and ready to receive signal and messages (even already pending), so the user must take care of installing a proper callback (if needed) using mbox_register_callback() on the channel before enabling it. For this reason it is recommended that all the channels are disabled at probe time.

Enabling a channel for which there is no installed callback is considered undefined behavior (in general the driver must take care of gracefully handling spurious interrupts with no installed callback).

parameterdescription.para: Set to 0 to disable and to nonzero to enable.
If it isn't an inbound channel.

briefdescription.para: Return the maximum number of channels.

detaileddescription.para: Return the maximum number of channels supported by the hardware.

simplesect.para: Maximum possible number of supported channels on success, negative value on error.

briefdescription.para: Generic low-level multi-channel inter-processor mailbox communication API.
